key_insight: Large-scale, automatically synthesized forecasting questions derived from daily news can be used to train language models to reason about the future, while careful offline curation prevents leakage of future information.
problem_solved: Addresses the scarcity of scalable, open-ended forecasting training data and the risk of leaking future information during model training and evaluation, enabling models to learn to make predictions about real-world future events.
method: Automatically synthesize novel open-ended forecasting questions from global events reported in daily news via a fully automated curation pipeline.
Assemble the resulting corpus (OpenForesight) and fine-tune Qwen3 ‘thinking’ models on these generated forecasting tasks.
Adopt an offline curation/evaluation protocol and temporal safeguards to prevent training or evaluation exposure to true future outcomes (mitigating data leakage).
impact: Provides a scalable dataset and workflow for training models to perform open-ended forecasting, useful for building AI systems that support decision-making under uncertainty without contaminating training data with future knowledge.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: news articles → automated question synthesis → OpenForesight dataset → Qwen3 training
Timeline / cutoff visual showing offline snapshoting to prevent future-data leakage
Example card: news snippet + synthesized forecasting question + model answer
Bar or line chart comparing forecasting coverage (quantity/types of questions) and temporal robustness versus conventional datasets
paper_title: Scaling Open-Ended Reasoning to Predict the Future
paper_authors: Nikhil Chandak, Shashwat Goel, Ameya Prabhu, Moritz Hardt, Jonas Geiping
